document_data.mainbody:
Alayna was a hakima and the only daughter of Alia bint Hazir and Sultan Yusef al-Wadi of Gana in the Pearl Cities region of west Zakhara.
Alayna was uncomfortable with her parental situation and worried about what the future would bring. She devoted her time to a quiet holy life aiding others.
She had a mole under her right eye in the shape of a butterfly.
As with all of her siblings, Alaynas parentage was kept secret from the population of Gana. She was raised in a monastery high in Al-Yabki Mountains.
